text: "The sandwiches were really good. The service was amazing. I just wish the prices can be a bit more transparent. We ordered one with a full loaf of bread and a different one with half a loaf of bread
column5: the total was $41. It was a lot of food but we almost didn't bring enough cash. I can't find prices listed anywhere
column6: and other reviews don't seem to talk about prices either."

author: Carlee Simon
text: 'Have been here a couple times and the sandwiches never disappoint! Most recently
column5: I walked in to get some chicken salad to go. I asked about a roll/baguette as they were ringing me up

author: Mary Attaway
text: 'I had a pig and fig sandwich here that I think about maybe too much. Just perfect from the bread to the ingredient portions
column5: which I sometimes feel like can be overdone in old school places in the spirit of giving ‚Äúmore‚Äù but then you end up with deli meat so sky high you can‚Äôt even take a bite. That was not the case - this was a truly perfect sandwich in every respect. Good customer service and entertaining environment. Will be back for more.'

author: Maryann Rivera. maryann
text: 'Rostpork was delicious.'

author: Nick Lenzi
text: "Hands down my favorite place to grab a sandwich in Hoboken. They have daily specials that you can find on their Instagram but the day to go in my opinion is the weekends to grab Frankie's Buffalo Chicken Sandwich. The sauce on it is the best buffalo sauce I've ever tasted. Also it's a bakery so you can get some really great breads here too. Just expect it to take a bit to get in an out for some reason it always takes 20 minutes no matter how many people are in line."

author: R. Serrano
text: "I've been a customer of this place since I was a kid. I'm 37 years old and still a customer.  Enough said!"

author: Jojo Gian24
text: 'Best Mozzarella in Hoboken! Amazing specials like Focaccia on Saturdays
column6: Eggplant Parmigiana. So lucky to have a little bit of Italy so close by.'

author: Claudia Luna
text: 'My favorite local fresh mozzarella! Hoboken‚Äôs best!'

author: Savanas Design
text: 'Only ever had the turkey and roast beef with mutz but WOW. Turkey sandwiches are often mediocre
column5: but this one is the BEST one I have ever had. Roast beef is out of this world. Can‚Äôt wait to try some of the others. Add ANY of the peppers - they are all great. Also... seriously the best mutz in Hoboken - you don‚Äôt have to look any further! Always friendly and fast service.'

text: 'Everything here is delicious and fresh. Sandwiches are huge and reasonably priced for the size and quality (basically 2 small sandwiches worth)!'

author: Yolanda Flores
text: 'The Losurdo‚Äôs is like going back to the past in a good way. It‚Äôs one of those deli‚Äôs that remind you when you was a kid. Your mother sends you with a note and they already know what you‚Äôre going to get. It‚Äôs family owned and they‚Äôve kept up family tradition
column5: a close knit family. Food is delicious
column6: you have to try Ricotta pie and the canoli‚Äôs. If you ever in Hoboken please stop in every thing I mentioned you‚Äôll see for yourself and lots of Italian traditional goodies to choose from. Stop in !!!'

text: "Best chicken cutlet I've ever had! They're daily specials are always great in addition to having everything you'd expect from an old school Italian deli. There are a lot of great delis in Hoboken and this is one of the best!"

text: 'A Hoboken institution. Everything is good - sandwiches
column6: sides
column9: and coffee too. Good assortment of products from Italy as well.'

author: Jennifer Lowney
text: 'Our favorite neighborhood place!  The food is delicious and always prepared like they are making it for family. Sandwiches are amazing and made exactly how you like them. There is a great variety of hot food as well. The eggplant is the best you‚Äôll get anywhere.  Also great imported Italian goods. Nutella in a glass jar
column5: not plastic. And we love people even more than the food!'

author: Joseph Juliano
text: "Don't get there often but when I do it's always a win. In a town where there is no shortage of Old School Italian spots Losurdo is at the top of the most try list. Patiently waiting for them to open up again soon."

author: Jason Swankoski
text: 'Everything about this place is great. Quality food
column5: quality people and quality product.\n\nA classic deli experience!'

author: Kimberly Favara
text: 'These guys are the real deal. The BEST mutz in Hoboken. I know that\'s a bold assertion
column5: but it\'s true. Everything is made fresh on premises including their bread. They make all the old school Italian specialities that you grew up eating for different holidays
column6: my personal fave is the Pizza Rustica at Easter. Also their foccacia that they make on Saturdays is so good: light and airy not heavy at all. My advice get a baby foccacia as a sandwich! Better be there right when the foccacia comes out of the ovens at 11am otherwise you\'re going to have to fight all the Nonnas. Another bold statement: best cannolis in town. Yes
column7: they are better than that "famous" baker in town. You pretty much can\'t go wrong at Losurdo\'s!'

author: michela signorile
text:
'(Translated by Google) A very interesting place .... many Italian products are perhaps only Italian products
Delicious sandwiches focaccia first biscuits all made with Italian products !!!
Excellent cold cuts and cheeses!
And not to mention the exquisite mozzarella made by them !!!! As an Italian in New York I feel at home !!!

(Original)
Un posto molto interessante.... molti prodotti italiani forse sono solo prodotti italiani
Dei panini squisiti focaccia primi biscotti tutti lavorati con prodotti italiani!!!
Salumi e formaggi ottimi!
E per non parlare delle mozzarelle fatti da loro in modo squisito!!!! Da italiana a New York mi sento a casa!!!'

text: "Old school corner Italian deli. Everything I've had is fresh and first rate. The wacky local clientele who stop by on a regular basis only adds to the charm."

text: 'I don‚Äôt want to share as to let everyone know how amazingly not good this place is

column6: if that‚Äôs your hang. What can I say
column7: your family.  Wait.  Phone‚Äôs ringing.  Its your mom.  She said the family‚Äôs waiting.'

author: Brian Lynch
text: "Going to Losurdo Brothers makes you realize that there's still old fashioned values that make great food. Everything is always top notch. This Deli is the cleanest and most delicious food in Hoboken.  They still make fresh mozzarella every day and its phenomenal.  Run don't walk to Losurdo Brothers"

author: Jennifer O'Brien
text: 'I love love love love love love love this deli. It is my favorite mutz in Hoboken. I get the unsalted mutz some days and sometimes the regular mutz. The staff is super friendly. Tons of options to choose from!! My family has been coming here for as long as I can remember. The sandwiches are always delicious!!!  The shelf products fantastic
column6: the experience of the place just perfect!! Also
column7: suuuuuper clean inside and I love that so much!!!\n\nThe update they have done to their social media pages makes me hungry all the time to the point where I crave going here to grab food! These guys are just amazing as people and with the food!! If you haven‚Äôt checked them out you need to get in there!!!!'

author: RS GAMING
text: "The turkey and cheese sandwich changed my life. Get here early this place closes early afternoon. Ive been in the Hoboken area for years and had never stopped in here because it closes early. I was up early and stopped in. When you walk in the meats are hanging and THAT is always a good sign. I ordered the turkey and cheese with everything including mayo......that sandwich has me unable to eat any other turkey and cheese. I can't imagine how good he specialty sandwiches are!"

text: 'The salads... the sandwiches... the bread! Wow!! Pretty much one of the best delis that I have ever been. Staff is really nice. I will definitely come back to this place. Strongly recommend it!'
